item.title: Acute Limb Ischaemia
item.description: An 80-year-old lady is admitted under medics following a fall with a long lie. She has a background of hypertension and T2DM. She mobilises with a frame and has twice daily carers. She is confused and cannot give a history. Her problem list is: Fall with long lie Acute confusion New AF On admission, the patient was noted to have bilateral cool lower limbs with absent pedal pulses. After 24 hours of fluid therapy, the right leg remains cool and painful.
